item.title: The Lord of the Rings: Return to Moria's first expansion launches next month, even if gameplay is currently MIA
item.content:encoded:
I hope they're not folking around

It's been more than a year since The Lord of the Rings: Return to Moria first launched, and now it seems like the survival crafting game's first proper expansion is right around the corner. Developer Free Range Games shared a new trailer yesterday, which was roughly Durin's Day, a rare Dwarven event in the world of Middle-earth, appropriately revealing the release date for said expansion, Durin's Folk.

It's less than a month out in fact, due to be released this coming November 18th, and while there are some details already available for the DLC, there's one slightly odd thing about it: there's no gameplay. There have been a couple of blog posts, and even a podcasty thing all about it, the posts complete with screenshots, but there doesn't appear to be a lick of footage of the thing in motion. Perhaps a point to be concerned about when there's so little time until it arrives; I wouldn't be surprised if it's just not quite ready to be properly shown and the folks at the top of the food chain want a date out to meet some kind of internal target, but that's just conjecture.

Still, those details! On the story side of things, you'll be learning about Dwarves from the Fourth Age, and a new end-game story chapter will be there for you to play through. There'll also be NPCs you can rescue and recruit down in the mines, of whom will help you out in your settlement, becoming typically dwarvey things like blacksmiths and brewmasters.

There's some new procedurally generated dungeons to presumably mine and plunder, which can be done alone or in multiplayer. The expansion also lets you explore outside the mountain too, including Durin's Tower, and an area to build some big bases. Lastly, the end-game economy is getting an update, offering up new materials, items, and recipes to unlock lore and other bits.

Presumably at some point in the next few weeks a proper trailer will be shown off, but off not, I suppose you'll find out when The Lord of the Rings: Return to Moria's Durin's Folk expansion launches on November 18th.
